tfm package¶

Submodules¶

tfm.bookmarks module¶

class tfm.bookmarks.bookmarks(path_to_bookmark_file: str)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles the bookmarks as file and as list of dicts.

add_bookmark(name: str, path: str)[source]¶

Adds a new bookmark. Does nothing, if another bookmark with the same name already exists or the | character is in the chosen name. The bookmark will be saved to the bookmark file that was chosen on instantiation of this class.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the new bookmark. This will be shown in the UI.

  • path (str) – Path which the bookmark should lead to.

bookmark_exists(name: str) → bool[source]¶

Returns True if the bookmark with the given name exists and False, if it doesn’t.

Parameters

name (str) – Name of the bookmark to check for.

Returns

True if bookmark exists, False if it doesn’t.

Return type

bool

get_all() → List[Dict[str, str]][source]¶

Returns all bookmarks as a list of dicts.

Returns

List of dicts of all bookmarks. The dicts follows the format {‘name’: ‘’, ‘path’: ‘’}

Return type

List[Dict[str, str]]

get_bookmarks_from_file(path: str) → List[Dict[str, str]][source]¶

Gets bookmarks from a file.

Parameters

path (str) – Path to the file, in which the bookmarks are saved.

Returns

List of dicts containing name and path of the bookmarks. The dicts follow this structure: {‘name’: ‘’, ‘path’: ‘’}

Return type

List[Dict[str, str]]

get_path_from_name(name: str)[source]¶

Returns the path that is registered with the given bookmark name. If the name doesn’t exist, it returns False.

Parameters

name (str) – The of the bookmark to which the path is requested.

Returns

The path registered with the given bookmark name, or False, if the name doesn’t exist

Return type

str | bool

remove_bookmark(name: str)[source]¶

Removes a bookmark from the internal bookmark list. It also rewrites the updated list to the bookmark file chosen on class instatiation. :param name: The name of the bookmark that should be deleted. :type name: str

tfm.mounts_model module¶

class tfm.mounts_model.mounts_model(*args, context: pyudev.core.Context, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PySide2.QtCore.QAbstractListModel

Provides a Qt-compatible data model, handling the listing and mounting of devices.

add(device: pyudev.device._device.Device)[source]¶

Adds a device to the model, if it’s not already a part of it.

Parameters

device (Device) – The device to add.

data(index: int, role: int)[source]¶

Returns the data of the object in a Qt-conforming way. If the given role is DisplayRole it returns the name of the device as a string, if it’s DecorationRole it returns an icon according to it’s mount state.

Parameters

  • index (int) – Index of the item in the data structure.

  • role (int) – Item role according to Qt.

Returns

Device name or icon according to mount state.

get_available_mounts() → List[pyudev.device._device.Device][source]¶

Returns a list of mountable partitions.

Returns

List of mountable partitions

Return type

List[Device]

get_device_at(index: int) → pyudev.device._device.Device[source]¶

Returns the device at the given index.

Parameters

index (int) – Index of the wanted device.

Returns

The device at the index in the model.

Return type

Device

get_mount_point(device: pyudev.device._device.Device) → str[source]¶

Looks for a mount point of the given device, using the findmnt command. Returns an empty string, if there is none.

Parameters

device (Device) – The device, of which the mount point is needed.

Returns

The mount point or an empty string, if it doesn’t exists

Return type

str

remove(device: pyudev.device._device.Device)[source]¶

Removes a device out of the model, if it exists.

Parameters

device (Device) – The device to remove.

rowCount(index: int) → int[source]¶

Returns the number of mountable devices in a Qt-conforming way.

Parameters

index (int) – unused, but needed by Qt.

Returns

Number of mountable devices.

Return type

int

staticMetaObject = <PySide2.QtCore.QMetaObject object>¶
toggle_mount(device: pyudev.device._device.Device)[source]¶

Mounts an unmounted device or unmounts a mounted device using the udevil command.

Parameters

device (Device) – The device to mount or unmount.

tfm.paste_worker module¶

class tfm.paste_worker.paste_worker(*args, clipboard: PySide2.QtGui.QClipboard, target_path: str, marked_to_cut: List[str], **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PySide2.QtCore.QObject

Worker class, that is used to paste files in a different thread.

Signals: finished: is emitted, when the worker is done started: is emitted, when the worker starts and the clipboard is not empty ready: is emitted, when all file paths to paste are collected, contains the number of files to paste as int progress: is emitted, whenever a file is done being pasted, contains the number of files pasted so far

count_files(path_list: List[str])[source]¶

Counts all files (and not directories) in the give list of paths.

Parameters

path_list (List[str]) – List of file paths

finished¶
get_base_path(path_list: List[str])[source]¶

Determines the largest common path of the files in the given list of paths.

Parameters

path_list (List[str]) – List of file paths

recurse_dirs(path_list: List[str]) → List[str][source]¶

Recurses all directories in the given list of paths and adds the files and directories found there to the given list.

Returns

The original list of file paths extended by the contents of any directory in the original list

tfm.stack module¶

class tfm.stack.stack[source]¶

Bases: object

Provides a classic stack using a deque() data structure.

drop()[source]¶

Resets the entire stack by removing all of its elements.

empty() → bool[source]¶

Returns True if stack is emtpy and False if it isn’t.

Returns

Emptyness of the stack.

Return type

bool

pop()[source]¶

Removes and returns the top element of the stack.

Returns

Top element of the stack.

push(stack_element)[source]¶

Adds an element to the top of the stack.

Parameters

stack_element – The element which will be added to the stack.

size() → int[source]¶

Returns the size of the stack.

Returns

Number of elements in the stack.

Return type

int

top()[source]¶

Returns the top element of the stack.

Returns

Top element of the stack.

tfm.tfm module¶

class tfm.tfm.tfm(args: List[str])[source]¶

Bases: PySide2.QtWidgets.QMainWindow, tfm.form.Ui_tfm

The main window class, setting up the application and implementing the needed events.

action_add_to_bookmarks_event()[source]¶

Adds the selected dir to the bookmark by the name the user gave it via a dialog.

action_back_event()[source]¶

Goes back one step in the navigation history. If after this, there are no more steps, it disables it’s button.

action_copy_event()[source]¶

Copies the currently selected files to the clipboard.

action_copy_path_event()[source]¶

Copy path of currently selected item to clipboard.

action_cut_event()[source]¶

Copies the current selection to the clipboard and marks them as cut.

action_delete_event()[source]¶

Throws the current selection in the trash after asking for confirmation.

action_forward_event()[source]¶

Goes forward one step in the navigation history. If after this, there are no more steps, it disables it’s button.

action_go_event()[source]¶

Changes the current dir to the one, that is given in the adress bar.

action_home_event()[source]¶

Changes the current dir to the users $HOME.

action_new_dir_event()[source]¶

Prompts the user for a dir name and creates one with that name in the current directory.

action_new_file_event()[source]¶

Prompts the user for a file name and creates one with that name in the current directory.

action_paste_event()[source]¶

Pastes the files currently in the clipboard to the current dir.

action_remove_bookmark_event()[source]¶

Removes the selected bookmark after asking the user for confirmation.

action_rename_event()[source]¶

Prompts the user to enter a new name and changes the selected file’s name.

action_show_hidden_event()[source]¶

Shows hidden files and dirs in the main view.

action_up_event()[source]¶

Changes the current dir to one dir up in the hierarchy

bookmark_selected_event()[source]¶

Changes the current dir to the one associated with the selected bookmark.

connect_actions_to_events()[source]¶

Connects actions to their event functions.

devices_changed(action: str, device: pyudev.device._device.Device)[source]¶

Updates the mountable devices. Is run, when udev detects a change in the block device subsystem.

Parameters

  • action (str) – Action that happened to the block device.

  • device (Device) – Device that changed it’s status.

fs_tree_event()[source]¶

Changes the current dir to the dir selected in the fs_tree view.

item_open_event()[source]¶

Opens a file using xdg-open, runs it, if it is executeble or changes the current dir if it’s dir.

item_selected_event()[source]¶

Updates statusbar info, depending on the selected file.

mount_selected_event()[source]¶

Checks the mount point of the selected drive and makes it the current path.

mount_toggle_event()[source]¶

Tries to mount or unmount the selected drive.

progress_dialog_cancel()[source]¶

Tells the paste worker to cancel its work

progress_dialog_init(maximum: int)[source]¶

Initializes the progress dialog and sets its maximum value.

Parameters

maximum (int) – The total amount of files to be pasted.

progress_dialog_update(value: int)[source]¶

Updates the progress dialog.

Parameters

value (int) – Amount of files already pasted.

set_context_menus()[source]¶

Setup context menus.

set_icons()[source]¶

Adds icons to all applicable actions.

set_shortcuts()[source]¶

Set shortcuts for actions.

staticMetaObject = <PySide2.QtCore.QMetaObject object>¶
update_current_path(next_path: str, skip_stack=False, reset_forward_stack=True)[source]¶

Updates the current path to the value given in next_path. It also updates the UI accordingly and changes the forward an backward stacks, if needed.

Parameters

  • next_path (str) – The path to the directory that should become the next dir.

  • skip_stack (bool) – This determines wether the stack handling should be skipped. Default value is False.

  • reset_forward_stack (bool) – This determines wether the forward stack should be reset or not. Default is True
